noun.description: A yellow oxychloride of lead and antimony, now regarded as identical with nadorite.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in American Journal of Science. From ochro- + -lite, after German Ochrolith (G. Flink 1889, in Öfversigt af Kongl. Vetenskaps-Akademiens Förhandlingar ((Stockholm)) 46 5).
